conclusion: Two parallel metal rails with spacing L = 0.5 m at angle Œ∏ = 30¬∞ to horizontal
Uniform magnetic field B = 0.2 T pointing vertically upward
Rod a: mass m_a = 0.3 kg, resistance R = 0.1 Œ©
Rod b: mass m_b = 0.1 kg, resistance R = 0.1 Œ©
Force F = 2 N pulling rod a upward along the rails
When rod a has velocity v_a = 1.0 m/s, its generated Joule heat is Q_a = 0.12 J
Gravitational component along the rails for rod a: m_a g sinŒ∏ = 1.5 N (downward)
Gravitational component along the rails for rod b: m_b g sinŒ∏ = 0.5 N (downward)
EMF in each rod is given by: ùìî = BLv
Total EMF when rod a moves with velocity v_a: ùìî = BL(v_a - v_b)
Current in the circuit: I = (BL(v_a - v_b))/(2R)
Joule heat generated in rod a: P_a = (B^2L^2(v_a - v_b)^2)/(4R)
Solving for v_b: (1.0 - v_b)^2 = 4.8, v_b = -1.19 m/s
Rod b is moving in the opposite direction to rod a, which is downward along the rails
Electromagnetic force for rod a: IBL = (B^2L^2(v_a - v_b))/(2R)
Electromagnetic force for rod b: IBL = (B^2L^2(v_a - v_b))/(2R)
At constant velocities, the net force on each rod should be zero
The speed magnitude of rod b at the given moment is 1.19 m/s, moving downward along the rails
